rename.from: Kafka: Provide feedback on failed (req/response) Command messages
rename.to: Kafka: Provide feedback on failed Command messages

issue.title: [#2661] Use Throwable param in CommandContext methods
issue.body:
This is for #2661.

This is a preparation for letting the KafkaBasedCommandContext send Command Response messages in the release/modify/reject methods. The new Throwable param allows an error message and an error status code to be given.

In the first commit:
Move/rename the `AbstractProtocolAdapterBase#getClientFacingErrorMessage()` method to the `ServiceInvocationException` class.
Also fix setting of an error message in CoapErrorResponse.

body:
The idea is now to (first) implement sending error command responses for _request/response_ command messages.

I would make these messages distinguishable from command responses sent from the device itself by using a special content type, namely `application/vnd.eclipse-hono-delivery-failure-notification+json`.

issue.title: [#2661] Document Hono sending Kafka error command responses
issue.body:
This is for #2661:

Adds documentation for the new feature that the Command Router or a protocol adapter sends an error command response message if a Kafka request/response command message couldn't be delivered to the device (or can't be processed by it).

Also improves the documentation of the AMQP command & control spec regarding the `released` and `rejected` delivery outcomes.

issue.title: [#2661] Pass CommandResponseSender to KafkaBasedCommandContext
issue.body:
This is a preparation for #2661, passing a `CommandResponseSender` to the `KafkaBasedCommandContext` constructor.

In a followup commit, the sender will then get used in the release/modify/reject methods to send delivery error command response messages.

issue.title: [#2661] Send Kafka command response message on delivery error
issue.body:
This is for #2661.

In the release/modify/reject methods of the `KafkaBasedCommandContext`, a Kafka error command response message will be published now, provided the original command is a request/response command with a correlation id.

issue.title: Fix command tenant/device 404 handling, adapt command tracing
issue.body:
Relates to #2661:
The Command Router handles commands, for which the corresponding tenant or device is disabled or doesn't exist, with a 'rejected' disposition now (instead of 'released').
Tracing of command handling errors has been moved into the CommandContext classes.

body: Implemented for request/response command messages - see #2728, #2712.
@calohmn can you also add an entry to the release notes?
